Jindra Gensior

Astrophysicist at the Department of Astrophysics, University of Zurich

Read More

Sinergia postdoctoral fellow at the Department of Astrophysics (formerly Institute for Computational Science), University of Zurich. I am interested in constraining what sets the structure and drives turbulence within the interstellar medium of galaxies, understanding the star formation and feedback physics that drive galaxy formation and evolution and identifying the bottlenecks of the baryon cycle (and whether star formation can be one). My research primarily uses isolated galaxy and cosmological (zoom-in) simulations, but I also compare with observational data.
